definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: In some countries, the journalist’s privilege is included in the constitution.
sentences.chinese: 在有些國家，新聞工作者的特免權被納入憲法。

sentences.english: In view of his good behavior, we privilege him from a tax.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於他的良好表現，我們特免他納稅。

sentences.english: The rules on privilege apply to all stages of a case or proceeding.
sentences.chinese: 關於特免權的規則，適用於案件或者程序的所有階段。

definition: to right a wrong/to seek justice
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to have completed the mourning period (traditional)/to have served one's time
approved by His (or Her) Majesty/permission graciously granted (from highly authoritative position)/to graciously permit/to condescend to allow
